1: Of David Unto thee, (O LORD) I lift up my soul.
2: My God, I trust in thee: Oh let me not be confounded, lest mine enemies triumph over me.
3: For all they that hope in thee shall not be ashamed: but such as be scornful dispisers without a cause, they shall be put to confusion.
4: Shew me thy ways, O LORD, and teach me thy paths.
5: Lead me in thy truth, and learn me, for thou art the God of my health, and in thee is my hope all the day long.
6: Call to remembrance, O LORD, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses, which have been ever of old.
7: Oh remember not the sins and offenses of my youth, but according unto thy mercy think upon me, O LORD, for thy goodness.
8: O how friendly and righteous is the LORD, therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
9: He leadeth the simple a right, and such as be meek them learneth he his ways.
10: All the ways of the LORD are mercy and faithfulness, unto such as keep his testament and covenant.
11: For thy name's sake, O LORD, be merciful unto my sin, for it is great.
12: Whatsoever he be that feareth the LORD, he shall shew him the way that he hath chosen.
13: His soul shall dwell at ease, and his seed shall possess the land.
14: The secret of the LORD is among them that fear him, and he sheweth them his covenant.
15: Mine eyes are ever looking unto the LORD, for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
16: Turn thee unto me and have mercy upon me, for I am desolate and in misery.
17: The sorrows of my heart, are great, O bring me out of my troubles.
18: Look upon mine adversity and misery, and forgive me all my sins.
19: Consider how mine enemies are many, and bear a malicious hate against me.
20: O keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be confounded, for I have put my trust in thee.
21: Let innocency and righteous dealing wait upon me, for my hope is in thee.
22: Deliver Israel, O God, out of all his trouble.
